alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:39PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Coke and northeastern Sterling Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Sterling City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling City, Silver and The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
